The other one is similar to Playbill, [http://www.linotype.com/140591/PlaybillStdRegular-product.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828172959/http:/www.linotype.com/140591/PlaybillStdRegular-product.html "http://www.linotype.com/140591/PlaybillStdRegular-product.html")  
nut it's not an exact match.

IL SORRISO is a shortened version of the famous "wanted poster" font French Clarendon, created by William H. Page in 1865.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828172959im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FrenceClarendonWilliamPage1865sm_4539.jpg)
 An authentic digital version by Wooden Type Fonts as Clarendon Heavy [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828172959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/")  
IL SORRISO would seem to be a photolettering era version that has not been digitized. Clarendon Heavy can be modified to look almost identical
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828172959im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ClarendonHeavyModified_4912.jpg)
